intro: Hypoestes antennifera, commonly known as the "Rainbow Plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble petals. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and a bluish-green hue. It produces small, tubular flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Hypoestes antennifera thrives in well-drained soil and prefers bright, indirect light.
